alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 9:27AM CDT until April 04 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN ROCK ISLAND...NORTHWESTERN HENRY...SOUTHEASTERN CEDAR... SCOTT...NORTHEASTERN MUSCATINE AND SOUTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 926 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Walcott, or near Durant, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 914 AM, a trained spotter reported two inch hail south of Wilton. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... Plainview around 930 AM CDT. Maysville and West Lake Park around 935 AM CDT. Donahue and Mississippi Valley Fairgrounds around 940 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Davenport, Eldridge, Long Grove, Davenport Municipal Airport, Park View, Scott County Park, Bettendorf, McCausland, Le Claire, Princeton, Port Byron, Cordova, Low Moor, Princeton Wildlife Area, Rock Creek Park, Rock Creek Marina and Campground and Folletts. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
